thread.title: The Times recommends: James McNeal, Andy Rheaume, Davina Duerr for Bothell City Council
thread.title_full: The Times recommends: James McNeal, Andy Rheaume, Davina Duerr for Bothell City Council | The Seattle Times

author: Seattle Times editorial board
title: The Times recommends: James McNeal, Andy Rheaume, Davina Duerr for Bothell City Council
text:
BOTHELL’S low-key, residential feel is misleading.
Politics in the growing city north of Lake Washington has become as intense as its rush-hour traffic.
It boiled over last year when word surfaced that City Hall gave up its option to acquire precious green space along the Sammamish River and Mayor Joshua Freed — a developer — had bought it to build 50 homes.
An investigation concluded that Freed did not violate state ethics rules. But the City Council appears to have skirted open-meetings rules by relinquishing its option on the back half of the Wayne Golf Course behind closed doors.
The brouhaha galvanized residents already frustrated by a costly City Hall, the slow pace of downtown revitalization efforts and paralyzing traffic congestion.
Ultimately, a deal was made to preserve the open space — Freed agreed in June to sell it back. The flap also increased citizen engagement, inspiring a new generation of civic leaders.
AMONG those new leaders is James McNeal , co-founder and president of the OneBothell civic group and a candidate for Bothell City Council Position No. 4.
The Times recommends: James McNeal
Bothell City Council Position 4
Strengths : Leadership; experience as a construction manager; advocacy for Bothell
McNeal is the best candidate in this race because of his leadership, experience as a construction manager and advocacy for Bothell locally and with other jurisdictions recruited to preserve the open space. ..."
McNeal is the best candidate in this race because of his leadership, experience as a construction manager and advocacy for Bothell locally and with other jurisdictions recruited to preserve the open space.
Those attributes and his commitment to make Bothell a more transparent and careful steward of its assets outweigh concerns about his past legal troubles, including a DUI and tax-payment problems when his small business flailed before the recession.
If elected, McNeal should work to ensure that he represents all quarters of Bothell.
VOTERS may be ready for a fresh start after all the turbulence at Bothell City Hall. But in the race for City Council Position No. 2, incumbent Andy Rheaume should be elected to another term.
The Times recommends:
